Trauma History: The patient experienced abusive parenting and lived in a foster home, indicating a challenging childhood
Substance Use History: The patient mentioned issues related to someone else's excessive drinking, but did not indicate personal substance use
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been feeling anxious, stressed, and somewhat sad, particularly due to pressures from not working and receiving bad news. They also expressed difficulty in controlling their temper and reflected on past arguments that have caused frustration
Medical and Psychiatric History: The patient has not been diagnosed with PTSD but acknowledges experiencing depression or sadness, with a history of seeking help for improvement
Psychosocial History: The patient is originally from Los Angeles and appreciates the arts, weather, and people there. They have two children who are doing well, and they feel lucky to have them. They also mentioned feeling close to their son but less so with their daughter
Physiological Observations: The patient reported difficulty sleeping, often waking up after an hour or two, and feeling tired and depressed as a result
Progress Evaluation: The patient feels there have been very little changes since starting therapy, indicating uncertainty about its effectiveness
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient practices meditation as a way to relax and has received help from therapists in being less hard on themselves
